channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why Sanae Takaichi’s supermajority in Japan is good news for India
$100 million for girlfriend & more… Who gets what as per Jeffrey Epstein’s will?
In Graphics | Who is Jimmy Lai, media tycoon sentenced to 20 years by Hong Kong court?
Yunus, Tarique, Jamaat and Gen Z: The architects of Bangladesh's future
What are the new biometric rules leading to long queues, delays at European airports?
Thai PM Anutin Charnvirakul claims election victory. Can he deliver a stable govt?
Operation Herof 2.0: Pakistan is a pawn in the new Great Game in Balochistan
item.description: Operation Herof 2.0 may ultimately be remembered as the moment when Pakistan failed to realise that it is no longer the kingmaker playing the Great Game but a pawn in the hands of great powers getting played in the very same game

item.title: Japan: Sanae Takaichi secures a historic mandate, but uphill challenges lie ahead
item.description: Although Takaichi may enjoy the proverbial political honeymoon phase for a while, in the longer term, she has to do a lot of balancing acts in ensuring her popular base while steering the country forward amidst regional and global tumult and geopolitical unpredictability

item.title: PM Modi's Malaysia visit: A diplomatic catch-up or a strategic reset?
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s stand-alone visit to Malaysia remains a careful step toward keeping doors open in an increasingly contested Indo-Pacific

item.title: Beyond ‘Ikkis’: Arun Khetarpal and Hanut Singh’s heroics in the 1971 war
item.description: From the battlefield of Basantar to the pages of history, saint-soldier Lt Gen Hanut Singh and young champ Second Lt Arun Khetarpal embodied courage, strategy, and sacrifice that transcended their era

item.title: India-US trade deal: A strategic win or a tough choice?
item.description: The true measure of success for India’s latest trade manoeuvres will lie in execution. If India leverages improved market access to accelerate its manufacturing, broaden its export portfolio, and attract investment into high-tech industries, it could pave the way for long-term economic resilience

item.title: How Islamabad Shia mosque bombing fits Pakistan’s history of manufactured crises
item.description: Several incidents illustrate an alleged pattern: the army uses violence as a tool to manipulate narratives, secure budgets, and maintain control, often at the expense of its citizens, to project itself as a necessary evil to fend off against India
